title: Who are the most influential historians ever? - Quora

response.answer_text: Interesting the word you chose… Influential. On that i say many: Tucidites, Livy, Polybius, Herodoto, Machiavelli. But one is the most influential above all. Xenophon. Polybius, Cicero, Tacitus, Dionysius of Halicarnassus, Quintilian, Aulus Gellius and Longinus "ranked him among the best philosophers and historians". Now, why was he so influential? Scipio Aemilianusis carried a copy of his book Cyropedia, and it was also a favourite of Alexander the Great and Julius Caesar. That was a biography written about Cyrus the great, the founder of the Persian empire. It became latter on the mediavel ages and renaissance an inspiration for the “mirror of princes”, biographical books made to describe the great rulers. Alexander the Great carried Xenophon's Anabasis during his campaigns on Persia. The Anabasis was Xenophon's memoirs of him leading a mercenary army from modern day Irak to Greece. So he definitely influence Alexander the Great and Julius Caesar, considered the greatest military leaders on history. He influenced Machiavelli on the Prince (the most famous book on Geopolitics) and an entire historical genre.

Herodotus - ‘Father of History'.Thucydides - contemporary of Herodotus who focused on truth and realism.Edward Gibbon - father of modern history.Leopold von Ranke - father of modern academic history (historicism).Lewis Namier - influenced the focus on shorter periods.Marc Bloch - discussed the Historian's Craft.E.H. Carr - argued that historians could not escape their own subjective experience.Fernand Braudel - leading light of the Annales School.E.P.
